revised_title: Molecular Chaperones: Structure and Function of Thermus Thermophilus Chaperonin
tldr: The article describes the structure and function of a chaperonin from a thermophilic bacterium, Thermus thermophilus. The chaperonin consists of homologues to GroEL (cpn 60) and GroES (cpn 10) and shows a bullet-like shape in electron microscopy. The chaperonin's ability to induce productive folding, slow down folding rates, and arrest folding at different temperature ranges is discussed. The article also proposes a "folding intermediate reservoir" model to explain the chaperonin's function.
